title.narrative: Karamoja Growth, Health and Governance Activity

description.narrative: (Uganda): The Growth, Health and Governance activity is a Title II development food assistance program implemented in the districts of Kaabong, Kotido and Abim in northern Karamoja. The activity has three main objectives: (1) Livelihoods Strengthened (2) Nutrition among Children under two years Improved; and (3) Governance and Local Capacity for Conflict Mitigation Improved. The activity will reach 375,000 direct beneficiaries over a five-year period. Interventions are expected to include: diversifying livelihood assets and opportunities; promoting improved technologies and practices; improving infant and young child feeding practices; improving maternal health and nutrition in pregnant and lactating women; enhancing access to clean water/sanitation, and improving hygiene practices; promoting access to local health care; promoting and supporting strategies of local entities to stimulate good governance and mitigate conflicts.
